items.q: Why did it fail to detect any smart?
items.a:
Because this is a highly advanced device with one setting: “nope.”
Also, your smart may be temporarily out for snacks.
No. It is operating within its intended specifications: confidently wrong, 24/7.

items.q: What should I do when I get an error?
items.a:
Step 1: Take a deep breath.
Step 2: Say “kthxbye” to the idea of being smart today.
Step 3: Acquire more smart (see below), then re-run the scan.

items.q: How do I get more smart?
items.a:
Recommended methods include: reading literally one (1) page of a book, drinking water,
asking a friend “wait, how does that work?”, or Googling a thing instead of raw-dogging assumptions.

items.q: What does this result say about me as a stupid person?
items.a:
It says you have excellent taste in joke websites and a brave willingness to click buttons.
Being “not smart” here is a temporary vibe, not your destiny. Try again when your brain finishes buffering.

Yes. Please submit your appeal by whispering it into the nearest houseplant.
The houseplant will forward it to our legal team (a raccoon in a tiny tie).

items.q: Does this site store my data?
items.a:
Nope. No accounts, no tracking, no cookies.
We couldn’t track you even if we tried. (…we tried.)

items.q: I think I got a false positive once.
items.a: That was a reflection in your screen. Or a passing bird. Or maybe two rocks clacking together in your head and you mistook the sound for a thought. Startling? Sure. Smart? Absolutely not.
